description: Renal dose adjustment rules for antibiotics

cefepime.dialysis: 1 g IV after each dialysis session
cefepime.note: Dose reduction critical to prevent neurotoxicity

piperacillin_tazobactam.dialysis: 2.25 g IV q8h + 0.75 g after each dialysis

vancomycin.crcl_lt_10: 15-20 mg/kg IV q48-72h OR based on levels
vancomycin.dialysis: Give after dialysis, dose by levels

ceftriaxone.note: NO renal adjustment needed. Hepatic clearance.

metronidazole.note: NO renal adjustment for impairment. Hepatic metabolism.

levofloxacin.crcl_20_49: 750 mg IV x1, then 750 mg IV q48h
levofloxacin.crcl_10_19: 750 mg IV x1, then 500 mg IV q48h
levofloxacin.dialysis: 750 mg IV x1, then 500 mg q48h
levofloxacin.note: Complex dosing schedule for renal impairment

nephrotoxic_antibiotics.monitoring: Monitor SCr/BUN daily if on nephrotoxic agents

cockcroft_gault.note: Most commonly used for antibiotic dosing

mdrd.note: Less commonly used for antibiotic dosing, reports as mL/min/1.73m2

obesity.note: Use adjusted body weight for hydrophilic drugs (vancomycin, aminoglycosides)

critical_illness.note: Augmented renal clearance may occur. Higher doses may be needed.

elderly.note: Age >65 → assume some renal impairment even if SCr normal

hemodialysis.note: Dose after dialysis session. Check if drug is dialyzable.

peritoneal_dialysis.note: Different dosing than HD. Consult pharmacy.

dose_adjustment_algorithm.step_2: Determine CrCl category (normal, mild, moderate, severe, dialysis)
dose_adjustment_algorithm.step_3: Look up drug in adjustment table
dose_adjustment_algorithm.step_4: If adjustment required, apply appropriate dose/frequency change
dose_adjustment_algorithm.step_5: If nephrotoxic drug, add monitoring recommendation

notes: Ceftriaxone and metronidazole do NOT require renal adjustment
Vancomycin REQUIRES trough monitoring and dose adjustment
Cefepime must be dose-adjusted to prevent neurotoxicity
Elderly patients should have CrCl calculated (may be impaired despite normal SCr)
